About Me

Let me tell you a few things

BIO

I am a developer-in-training at Thaddeus Stevens College of Technology. I love building things from front-end to back-end. I am most attracted to solving real customer problems in the UI but also enjoys the obstacles the server side of software brings to me. I am still trying to find myself in this field. What keeps me going are these core values I truly cherish whether is in the field or life in general.

Core Values

    Disciplined
  • Being disciplined is one of the most important core values you could attain, showing control of your behavior when being told what to do and how to do it is very important.
    •  
    Perseverance
  • This right here is the key to success, it doesn’t matter how much knowledge you have in your field if you are determined enough to make it happen it will happen whether you want to learn JS, or C ++ you’ll always find a way. I firmly believe this is the most important trait a person could have. 
    • Humble
  • You need to show interest and in other people’s perspectives or point of view in things, it will make your life a lot easier because you will constantly find new ways to finish or approach projects in different ways. 

Teamwork

Ever since I was a little boy I played sports. I think playing team sports builds character but also gives you an insight to probem solving skills at an early age.

part 3

I am currently interested in an internship that involves computer software. I have very high interest in building my skills and expanding my knowledge in technology.
